page.title: 15LOCAL NEWS. 2
page.content: THIS IS AN EXTRACT FROM OUR LOCAL PAPER THE{AIRDRIE AND COATBRIDGE ADVERTISER.THE COMMUNITY COUNCIL HELD THEIR MONTHLY MEETING RECENTLY. A NUMBER OF PEOPLE TURNED UP TO HEAR THE RESULTS OF A PUBLIC MEETING THAT HAD BEEN HELD. THE MEMBERS WERE PLEASED TO HEAR THAT HOUSES IN PART OF GARTLEA ARE TO BE PARTIALLY MODERNISED.THIS WILL MEAN NEW WINDOWS, REWIRING, CENTRAL HEATING AND OTHER REPAIRS. AFTER THE BUSINESS WAS FINISHED, TWO MEMBERS OF ALCHOLICS ANONYMOUS GAVE AN INTERESTING TALK ON THE PROBLEMS THAT ALCHOLOLISM BRINGS. SOME MEMBERS FELT THAT THESE TALKS WOULD BE BETTER AIMED AT THE YOUNG PEOPLE IN THE AREA AND WERE SHOCKED TO LEARN THAT THREE AIRDRIE SECONDARIES HAD SHOWN LITTLE INTEREST. THE COUNCIL AGREED THAT UNDER-AGE DRINKING IS A PROBLEM IN AIRDRIE AND URGED ACTION.
